page.title: 03CHERRY LODGE FARM.(con'd)
page.content: There are also foxes, rabbits and badgers on the farm.The downland is very old and has not been ploughed for a very long time.It is covered with hundreds of anthills. The sheep and cattle graze on the grass and keep it short.This allows the large number of wild flowers to grow.The cattle are a rare breed called Longhorn Cattle. There are 21 cattle and 6 calves. They live between 16 and 20 years.On the farm there are also 1147 Scottish half breed sheep. On one side of the reserve is a dew pond that has been recently cleaned out. There are also important archaeological features on the reserve, including the remains of a field system,strip lynchets, a bowl barrow, and possible Saxon field boundaries.
